job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesFAC - GLOBAL FACILITIES SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST   Job Description  As an Corporate Facilities Data Scientist in the Facilities Central Group, you will do the following:  Work shoulder-to-shoulder in a world-class IT team of data engineers, business intelligence experts, and software engineers to discover data insights that were unobservable in traditional BI solutions. Draw from a broad background of data-mining techniques in mathematics, statistics, information technology, machine learning, data engineering, design of experiments, visualization, and text mining to discover insightful patterns in data. Take on exciting projects from all business areas at the Company, working across enterprise business processes to bring data science methods to opportunities in sales, supply chain, IT, finance, marketing, and other business areas. Deliver polished presentations of analyses to senior Company leaders to inform Company business strategy, streamline operations, and execute to revenue goals.   Responsibilities and Tasks    Align to, Understand, and Prioritize Analytic Goals to Address Business Opportunities and Value     Maintain an intimate understanding of company and department strategy Understand the business objectives in order to develop or establish success criteria metrics Translate business problems into one or more data science projects/solutions    Lead Efforts to Identify Signals in Data that Address Use Cases     Understand business processes (data sources and meaning) Manage and optimize data discovery and cleansing Understand and collect relevant data Identify new data sources in the network that will create new insights to business needs Explore relevant data through visualization and statistical methods   Collect, Organize, and Prepare Data for Analysis     Work with various volumes of data from multiple disparate sources and perform data analysis and mining to generate solutions to business problems Ensure processes taken to maintain data integrity Understand available data and what data is relevant Collaborate with data architects (IS engineers, BI engineers, DBAs, etc.) to ensure that data needed is available Develop and automate ETL jobs for various volumes of data    Uncover Patterns in Data, Develop Models, and Evaluate Validity of Solutions     Develop expertise in data mining and analytic methods Determine statistical validity and significance (pick out signals from noise) Identify and apply appropriate analytical models Evaluate results using statistical methods and improve the model where appropriate Develop predictive models   Deploy Data Science Models into Business Processes     Present findings and deliver recommendations using effective presentation and data visualization techniques Collaborate with software engineers to deploy data science solutions into production applications Ensure that the models are easy to support and maintain Regularly review deployed models and monitor for continual improvement Validate that the business value has been met
job_requirements: RequirementsEducation:   Masters Degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Statistics or equivalent is required Doctorate Degree or equivalent experience in Data Science, Engineering, Statistics or Computer Science is desired    Experience:   5 years’ experience in Data Analysis 3-5 years’ experience in Semiconductor
job_title: FAC - GLOBAL FACILITIES SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesResponsibilities:   1) Align to, Understand, and Prioritize Analytic Goals to Address Business Opportunities and Value   • Maintain an intimate understanding of company and department strategy   • Understand the business objectives in order to develop or establish success criteria metrics   • Translate business problems into one or more Facilities data science projects/solutions    2) Lead Efforts to Identify Facilities Signals in Data that Address Use Cases   • Understand business processes (data sources and meaning)   • Manage and optimize Facility equipment data discovery and cleansing   • Understand and collect relevant Facility equipment data   • Identify new data sources in the network that will create new insights to business needs   • Explore relevant Facility data through visualization and statistical methods    3) Collect, Organize, and Prepare Data for Analysis   • Work with various volumes of data from multiple disparate sources and perform data analysis and mining to generate solutions to business problems   • Ensure processes taken to maintain data integrity   • Understand available Facility equipment data and what data is relevant   • Collaborate with other data architects (IS engineers, BI engineers, DBAs, etc.) to ensure that data needed is available   • Develop and automate Extract, Transform and Load (ETL) jobs for various volumes of data    4) Uncover Patterns in Data, Develop Models, and Evaluate Validity of Solutions   • Develop expertise in data mining and analytic methods   • Determine statistical validity and significance (pick out signals from noise)   • Identify and apply appropriate analytical models   • Evaluate results using statistical methods and improve the model where appropriate   • Develop predictive models    5) Deploy Data Science Models into Business Processes   • Present findings and deliver recommendations using effective presentation and data visualization techniques   • Collaborate with software engineers to deploy data science solutions into production applications   • Ensure that the models are easy to support and maintain   • Regularly review deployed models and monitor for continual improvement   • Validate that the business value has been met
job_requirements: RequirementsRequirements:  •Bachelor, Master or equivalent experience in Statistics/Physics/Computer Science/Engineering/Operations Research/Applied Maths •Good knowledge in programming and statistics. •Excellent code writing abilities. •Experience in Data-mining and yield analysis. •Experience in developing application and data-source in Hadoop big data platform will be advantageous. •Knowledge in Equipment/Sensors (Motor, Drives, Instruments, PLC) will be advantageous.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAs a Non-Volatile Memory QRA (NVMQRA) Solid State Drive (SSD) Quality and Reliability Engineer at the Company, you will you will be responsible for managing quality and reliability of Company SSD products as these products enter into high volume production phase of product lifecycle. You will perform reliability testing and data analysis on material associated with sustaining qualifications through change requests, product proliferations, special work requests and conversions. You will also take part in the management of product deviation events, through participation in product containment activities and providing quality and reliability evaluation plans for risk assessment. You will also manage the outgoing quality and reliability (OQRM) metrics. You are expected to conduct failure analysis from qualification, evaluation and OQRM failures and report the resulting data. You can expect to conduct global meetings to determine product priorities or product dispositions. In this role you will work with various Engineering and Quality Reliability Assurance Groups to provide technical support, expertise, consultation and training. You should expect to support customers both internal and external to the Company on an on-going basis.   Responsibilities and Tasks     Manage Reliability evaluations for deviation management  Determine a reliability evaluation/trials plan Identify and manage material for sampling Perform data analysis of reliability tests results and/or by conducting failure analysis Close out evaluation and provide feedback to stakeholders  Identify deviated material within Material Review Board (MRB)  Take part in containment activities Determine a reliability evaluation/trials plan Identify and manage material for sampling Perform data analysis of reliability tests results and/or by conducting failure analysis Determine disposition of materials Close out evaluation and provide feedback to stakeholders  Manage and coordinate various inputs from various stakeholders in Quality Reliability  Collaborate with discrete component product quality and reliability team for product reliability evaluations/trials/plans Collaborate with package quality and reliability team for package-related reliability evaluations/trials/plans  Manage Product Outgoing Quality and Reliability Monitoring  Provide the plan for operations to execute for SSD product OQRM data collection Analyze the data from Company Manufacturing Execution System (MES) such as MAM Use statistical analysis tools to provide conclusions and verify results Summarize the result of analyzed data through a regular OQRM metrics report  Provide Expertise, Consultation and Training  Communicate Globally with NAND, Firmware, BUs and Engineering Groups for priority management Provide training to engineers and technicians within and outside of the group Maintain knowledge base (lessons learned) within the group for each SSD market segment Stay abreast of Quality and Reliability issues of Company NAND components Provide consultation for audits, RMA, and customer issues
job_requirements: RequirementsEducation: Required: Masters’ Degree in Electrical / Electronics/ Computer Engineering Desired: PhD in Electrical/Electronics/Computer Engineering   Experience: 2-3 years of experience in any of the following:  Managed NAND Product/Device engineering Non-volatile Memory Product/Device engineering Non-volatile Memory Process integration engineering Quality/Reliability engineering in semiconductor area    Qualifications  Basic knowledge and understanding of wafer fabrication process Basic knowledge and understanding of device physics Basic knowledge and understanding of NAND device operation Basic knowledge and understanding of  solid state drive operation Knowledge of various managed NAND protocol standards such as  SATA, SAS, PCIe, or NVMe Strong knowledge and understanding of semiconductor reliability statistics Good verbal and written communication skills Good time management and multi-tasking skills
job_title: GQ - NVMQRA QUALITY AND RELIABILITY ENGINEER - SSD

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Description As company's CTO System Engineer, you will need to be very familiar with the workings and interactions among various MES systems and machine systems to implement new process/equipment or perform troubleshooting on system issues. You will need to work with a cross-functional team, including process/equipment engineers, manufacturing team, IT and suppliers to understand, provide and implement solutions. You will also be directly responsible for any exploration, verification and implementation of any new MES system solutions to HVM environment. In addition, you will require to establish methodology for ease of data collection, documentation and metrics monitoring. Responsibilities and Tasks Develop and Support System Solutions •Understanding manufacturing process flow and quality control •Troubleshoot and provide solution for system issues •Develop system solutions for new process/equipment •Develop system solutions to improve manufacturing processes •Test out new solutions with extensive data collection and analytics    Data Storage and Reporting •Set up systems for data storage, data extraction and data analysis •Automate KPI metrics monitoring
job_requirements: RequirementsRequirements: •Minimum of a Bachelor's degree in Engineering. Mechatronics Engineering is preferred  •Able to develop applications with GUI on ASP.NET using C# or VBA •Able to write SQL for database transactions •Knowledge on XML and Microsoft Access •Ability to write Perl scripts is preferred •Excellent verbal and written communication skills with strong interpersonal, relationship and team building skills •Ability to work in team as well as independently •Experience in or knowledge on assembly operation, SAP & ASRS is preferred

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAs a MCT QE Technician, you will perform 1st level data analysis on the NCD% and GDM performance. You will be responsible to make sure the NCD% and GDM data is properly filled and analyzed. You will also be assisting engineering team with data extraction programs or related reporting tools, and identify areas for improvement regarding these responsibilities   Responsibilities and Tasks •Demonstrates good troubleshooting skills and logical thinking in identifying systematic quality issues and carrying out first level of data mining. •Should have excellent communication and interaction ability with other QE team members to work effectively and efficiently. •Publish clear reports and highlights on the key points in the weekly trend/issue tracking. •Good written and verbal skills to highlight to summarize on the observations and findings from the 1st level data mining. •Organized, structured and strong attention to detail when performing engineering task. •Actively support on non-engineering request (eg. Data compilation and presentation). •Be initiative and able to work independently with minimum supervision. •All team members are required to complete their learning items within the stipulated time frame
job_requirements: RequirementsSkillset: •Proficient in Microsoft Office, especially Excel •Understanding of SharePoint and MFG system (MES, Datanav, MESQDR etc)   Shift: 1DAY

job_description: Roles & Responsibilities  As a Procurement Program Manager at company, you will be responsible for working with the leadership team to manage projects and programs including communication and change management. The Procurement Program Manager will provide direction and guidance for managing programs consisting of multiple complex projects to achieve specific business goals and objectives while ensuring balance in allocation of resources. Accurate design and tracking of programs and projects to predict results and outcomes is critical to success. Analysis of program and project progress in terms of root cause analysis, pay-back assessment, risk, resources consumption, interdependencies and gaps. The Procurement Program Manager, will and can be a Project Manager on specific projects that are associated to the Program. The Procurement Program Manager will participate and support audits (both internal/external), he or she is responsible to help coordinates preparation for such audits.   Responsibilities and Tasks Initiate and Plan Projects •Define scope, goals and deliverables that support business goals in collaboration with sponsors and stakeholders •Define alignment of projects to purchasing areas of focus •Develop project plans and associated communications documents •Estimate the resources and participants needed to achieve project goals •Define metrics using appropriate data sources •Plan and schedule project timelines and milestones •Delegate tasks and responsibilities to appropriate personnel •Define project success criteria and disseminate them to involved parties throughout project life cycle •Determine the frequency and content of status reports from the project team   Execute, Monitor/Control, and Close Projects •Liaise with project stakeholders & sponsors on an ongoing basis •Determine and assess need for additional resources during the project cycle •Identify and manage project dependencies •Track project milestones and deliverables •Manage and communicate changes to project scope •Facilitate projects to sustaining mode or close out projects   Manage Project Team(s) •Identify and resolve issues and conflicts within the project team •Communicate project expectations to team members and stakeholders •Coach, mentor, motivate project team members •Provide recognition for progress and project member contributions   Improve Project Management Processes •Conduct project post-mortems and create recommendations based on successful and unsuccessful project elements •Identify and implement best practices, and use experience to evolve internal processes •Ensure alignment of project management business processes with PPMO team •Promote Project Management value and business practices to the organization •Provide Project Management Expertise   Program and Project Management process and associated documentation •Communicate and train Purchasing team on project approval process and use of project management templates •Maintain project management documentation templates (close-outs, charter, SIPOC, SWOT) •Use the Purchasing Program and Project SharePoint site to coordinate and report project highlights, status, and timelines •Participate and take an active role in Program workshops   Provide Business and Data Analysis Support •Research and analyze data •Create and manage Procurement data and reporting environment •Develop and manage organizational processes and information systems •Provide industry intelligence to support Procurement   You will need to participate in Site Audits and manage Site Compliance on Procurement.   For business process and/or QMS component that one is responsible or accountable for: •ensuring the QMS/business process that is effective and conforms to requirements; •ensuring that the processes are delivering their intended outputs; •reporting on QMS/business process performance and opportunities for improvement to management; •ensuring the promotion of internal and external customer focus throughout the organization; •ensuring the maintenance of the integrity of the QMS/ business process when changes are planned and implemented. •ensuring customer requirements are met   As a Site Process Steward/Key Assistant with the responsibilities: •Is an active member in business process review and improvement discussions among the site and the System Level Process team. •Hold site process review (quarterly for non-manufacturing processes and monthly for manufacturing processes.) •Responsible for introducing standard methods and deploying standard tools to his site. •Accountable for organizing process audits and demonstrating compliance to standards. •Act as the point of contact for bi-directional process communication (corporate ¢ral groups ßà local site). Work in alignment with related steering committees and Business Alignment Teams(BATs) where applicable. •Develop and maintain site specific process artifacts (when required by System Level Process). •Report process performance to site management. •Participate in the Business Process Management Center of Excellence (BPMCOE) when/if applicable. •Maintain local procedure, workflow, checklists as job aids for the performers. •Conduct regular reviews with site leadership.
job_requirements: RequirementsEducation Bachelor’s Degree  •Business Administration/Management •Supply Chain Management •Related field of study   Able to assemble, manage, mentor, and grow cross-functional teams from various internal and external organizations across multiple sites •Working knowledge of software systems and database structures •Experienced with working with third party suppliers in difficult and demanding situations •Presetting to higher management Certified/qualified auditor will be an added advantage   Qualifications •2-5 years of experience in Procurement Sourcing /Supply Chain/Supplier Management/Product Compliance activities (Manufacturing, QA, Marketing, etc.) •Proficient in Microsoft applications, along with excellent computer skills •Good communicator

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAs a Process Control System Run to run (R2R) Engineer at the Company, you will be responsible to develop smart manufacturing solutions towards the Industry 4.0 standard.  You will gain exposure and knowledge in many cutting edge areas including Machine Learning, advanced control solutions and deep learning. As a PCS R2R Engineer, you will have the opportunity to develop a complete solution that starts from requirements gathering, data analysis and modeling with big data platform, followed by system development and integration; and then fab wide implementation. The work you do directly affects the bottom line of the organization by enabling smart process control of manufacturing processes.   Responsibilities    Develop, implement and improve smart control solutions for optimum manufacturing performances. Develop, implement and improve data visualization solutions for monitoring the system performance. Develop, implement and improve full stack analytic platform that integrate Hadoop eco-system to real time process control applications to enable machine learning based process control. Conduct intensive data analysis and modeling to identify sources of variation in the process and translate it into control solutions. Provide technical oversight, guidance and support for process control implementation. Develop and deliver training on control systems and related topics.
job_requirements: RequirementsRequirements    Phd, Masters/Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science/ Engineering/ Statistics/ Mathematics/Physics Passion for programing and data analysis Preferred experience in Python/R/SQL/Hadoop eco-system Preferred experience in the development of web based applications Good communication and interpersonal skills.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Description: The Company is committed to environmental and safety excellence as we strive to be a global leader in memory and storage solutions. As the Global Construction Safety/Semiconductor Equipment Installation Safety Program Manager, you will be responsible for the successful development and implementation of key strategic initiatives and practices targeted at improving construction, equipment installation and compliance for the Company, operations globally.  The successful candidate will provide leadership, direction, education, and overall strategic management of the company’s safety management system and initiatives related to construction and equipment installation.  The Global Construction Safety/Semiconductor Equipment Installation Safety Program Manager will provide technical regulatory guidance/advice to the sites, staff, and senior management on construction safety policy and regulatory development matters related to the semiconductor industry.   Primary Job Responsibilities Include:  Provide leadership, direction, and education of key strategic initiatives targeted at improving safety culture and compliance Develop, implement, and monitor company safety programs and policies Lead implementation and best practice sharing of construction safety management Implement management system criteria into construction projects and programs across the Company network Perform compliance audits and support implementation of follow-up corrective actions to ensure compliance with country, state and local regulations Respond to emergencies and investigate incidents and recommends corrective action Resolve complex compliance matters, including use of required data and management systems Analyze data in compliance with current regulations, standards/policies and make appropriate recommendations to prevent new or recurring incidents Assure accuracy of reports and permits for compliance with country, state, and local regulations May provide leadership to less experienced engineers and to technicians May act as lead person or technical advisor on projects    Qualifications:  Extensive experience with hazard assessment, data analysis root cause investigation Strong technical expertise in the area of construction safety/equipment installation, in multi-national corporations Demonstrated ability to comfortably work across organizational boundaries and geographies Ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional organizations to understand needs and translate them into actionable plans, deliverables, and resource requirements Ability to be guided by business objectives and determine best methods for delivering results Demonstrated proficiency in independently completing complex tasks Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills Excellent oral and written communication skills Ability to adapt to a rapidly changing environment Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Proven facilitation skills including the ability to influence others Fluent computer skills including Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel
job_requirements: RequirementsEducation Required:  Minimum of a B.S. degree in Occupational Health Safety, Construction Safety Management, Industrial Hygiene or another relevant field    Experience Required:  Minimum of 7 years of relevant experience including demonstrated experience with construction safety management and/or semiconductor equipment installation experience Semiconductor experience The ability to read and develop a solid understanding and interpretation of regulations is required Ability to develop global programs and deploy to a multi-cultural audience Strong interpersonal communication Effective negotiation skills Proficiency in technical writing Strong team player skills
job_title: FAC - GLOBAL EHS CONSTRUCTION SAFETY PROGRAM MANAGER

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Description:   Company is committed to environmental and safety excellence as we strive to be a global leader in memory and storage solutions. As Manager/Snr Manager, Global EHS Construction, you will be responsible for the successful development and implementation of key initiatives and practices targeted at improving construction, and compliance for company operations globally.  The successful candidate will provide leadership, direction, education, and overall strategic management of the site safety management system and initiatives related to construction.  The Manager/Snr Manager, Global EHS Construction will provide direction to the site EHS Team, drive EHS Construction programs and provide technical regulatory guidance/advice to the site management, staff, and contractor management on construction regarding company policy, best known methods, and regulatory matters. This position will also oversee EHS consultant services deployed at the site. The Manager/Snr Manager, Global EHS Construction will work in areas such as fall protection, scaffolds, excavation, confined space, crane equipment operations, electrical, energy isolation, incident investigation, and other safety/health related training.   Primary Job Responsibilities Include:  Provide leadership, direction, and education of key strategic and program initiatives targeted at improving safety culture and compliance Implement and monitor company safety programs and policies Lead implementation and best practice sharing of construction safety management Implement management system criteria into the construction projects Perform compliance audits and support implementation of follow-up corrective actions to ensure compliance with country, state and local regulations Respond to emergencies and investigate incidents and recommends corrective action Resolve complex compliance matters, including use of required data and management systems Analyze data in compliance with current regulations, standards/policies and make appropriate recommendations to prevent new or recurring incidents Assure accuracy of reports and permits for compliance with country, state, and local regulations Provide leadership to staff, Team Members and contractors Act as lead person or technical advisor on various projects    Qualifications:  Extensive experience with hazard assessment, data analysis root cause investigation Strong technical expertise in the area of construction safety, in multi-national corporations Demonstrated ability to comfortably work across organizational boundaries and geographies Ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional organizations to understand needs and translate them into actionable plans, deliverables, and resource requirements Ability to be guided by business objectives and determine best methods for delivering results Demonstrated proficiency in independently completing complex tasks Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills Excellent oral and written communication skills Ability to adapt to a rapidly changing environment Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Proven facilitation skills including the ability to influence others Fluent computer skills including Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel
job_requirements: RequirementsEducation Required:  Minimum of a B.S. degree in Occupational Health Safety, Construction Safety Management, Industrial Hygiene or another relevant field desired. Extensive experience may be considered as a substitute for education at the discretion of company.    Experience Required:  Minimum of 15 years of relevant experience including demonstrated experience with construction safety management Prefer Semiconductor industry experience The ability to read and develop a solid understanding and interpretation of regulations is required Ability to develop site and global programs and deploy to a multi-cultural audience Strong interpersonal communication Effective negotiation skills Proficiency in technical writing Strong team player skills
job_title: MANAGER / SNR MANAGER, EHS SITE CONSTRUCTION

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesResponsibilities: ·Perform detail data analysis using various statistical/data mining tools to identify process root cause and fail mechanism of yield issues.  ·Work closely with Process Integration and Process & Equipment engineer to provide timely yield feedback to enable fast yield ramp to mature.  ·Use knowledge of semiconductor device physics, electronics and semiconductor manufacturing process to explain and resolve yield issues.  ·Participate in multi-area problem solving focus team to provide yield and failure analysis expertise to troubleshoot complex yield problems  ·Prepare detail and clear yield indices and reports/pareto of yield deviation to the Fab team to provide the direction of process improvements.  ·Serve as a key role in identifying and implementing new methods for yield analysis, and working with Yield Enhancement team to continuous improve YE process efficiencies.  ·Engage other sister Fabs to shares Best Known Methods (BKM) and yield learning  ·Coordinate in all Failure Analysis activities and characterization to narrow down process root cause of yield deviation and limiters.  ·Support transfer of next generation technology from R&D to production Fab as and when necessary  ·Work closely with RDA to identify and minimize inline defect gaps to end-of-line fails, and support them to provide inline die-loss for all defect related yield limiters  ·Mentor YE technician on daily yield analysis operation.
job_requirements: RequirementsRequirements:                 ·Bachelor’s or Master degree, preferred in one of the following: Electrical Engineering, Materials Science, Physics or related discipline and/or equivalent experience  ·Possess a good understanding of Semiconductor processes, especially in NAND Flash structure and function  ·Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to present data in large meetings  ·Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to work with people at all levels  ·Excellent organizational skills with a strong attention to detail  ·Possess good teamwork skills and strong multi-tasking capability  ·Strong knowledge of Fab process, good analytical and problem solving skills  ·Strong understanding of electrical testing and characterization and device physics with a FLASH background  ·Proficient in Microsoft Office and applications including JMP and UNIX  ·Possess experience in SEM, FIB, and emission microscope

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesDescription   As a Process Control System Run to run (R2R) Engineer at the Company, you will be responsible to develop smart manufacturing solutions towards the Industry 4.0 standard.  You will gain exposure and knowledge in many cutting edge areas including Machine Learning, advanced control solutions and deep learning. As a PCS R2R Engineer, you will have the opportunity to develop a complete solution that starts from requirements gathering, data analysis and modeling with big data platform, followed by system development and integration; and then fab wide implementation. The work you do directly affects the bottom line of the organization by enabling smart process control of manufacturing processes.
job_requirements: RequirementsResponsibilities  •Develop, implement and improve smart control solutions for optimum manufacturing performances. •Develop, implement and improve data visualization solutions for monitoring the system performance. •Develop, implement and improve full stack analytic platform that integrate Hadoop eco-system to real time process control applications to enable machine learning based process control. •Conduct intensive data analysis and modeling to identify sources of variation in the process and translate it into control solutions. •Provide technical oversight, guidance and support for process control implementation. •Develop and deliver training on control systems and related topics.   Requirements  •Phd, Masters/Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science/ Engineering/ Statistics/ Mathematics/Physics •Passion for programing and data analysis •Preferred experience in Python/R/SQL/Hadoop eco-system •Preferred experience in the development of web based applications •Good communication and interpersonal skills.
job_title: Process Control System Run to Run Engineer

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesGQ - NVM QRA ENGINEER   Job Description As a NVM QRA Engineer in Global Quality, you will provide support for product qualification programs, assist with failure analysis and data analysis toward qualification of next-generation 3D NAND memory devices. In this role, you will coordinate with multiple engineering teams to ensure appropriate product quality/reliability evaluation methods are developed and followed. You will be responsible for developing and overseeing outgoing monitor plans. You will perform risk assessments and provide product disposition for manufacturing teams dealing with quality and reliability issues. You will also be asked to gain new product knowledge, as well as develop and mentor new talent.   Responsibilities and Tasks   Define qualification plans, manage qualification requirements, comprehend failures and rates within the scope of qualification, and perform risk assessments on all critical read points within the qualification plan. Coordinate with other groups such as Process Development, Product Engineering, Design, Manufacturing and other engineering teams involved in the qualification process. Provide release documentation upon achieving qualification and set up plans to monitor the quality and reliability of the products in the production phase. Coordinate with Research and Development and Product Engineering teams to help comprehend new reliability issues and how to test for and assess their impact to customer risk and reliability. Assist and consult on post qualification quality and reliability issues and assist in the analysis and disposition of these materials. Perform product failure analysis on rejects.
job_requirements: RequirementsSkills and Experience  Rigorous use of statistical and analytical tools to help collect and resolve complex reliability and quality problems will be a fundamental aspect of this position. General knowledge of fab processing and device physics are required to be successful in this position. Ability to communicate clearly and concisely both verbally and in writing is critical in this role. Required to multitask and coordinate between multiple issues at any given time. Candidates with at least 2 years of experience in the semiconductor industry as QA or Product engineer are preferred. Fresh graduate may apply    Education  A Bachelor or Masters Degree in Electrical Engineering or similar field of study
job_title: GQ - NVM QRA ENGINEER / SR ENGINEER

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesResponsibilities: Probe Test Development Engineers develop and maintain wafer level test programs to test functionality of NAND Flash products. The general responsibilities of the position include but are not limited to the following:  Develop and maintain wafer level functional test strategies and programs for semiconductor NAND Flash products Collaborate with various engineering and production groups to ensure test program, infrastructure and system readiness for new product introduction as well as high volume manufacturing Improve device yield, reliability and quality through test condition optimization, advanced redundancy analysis schemes, data analysis and test equipment hardware optimization Provide cost effective and innovative solutions for production test flow optimization with cutting-edge test time reduction methodologies Develop and release test programs to production in a timely manner Assist process and production teams by providing necessary engineering expertise to ensure smooth manufacturing operations
job_requirements: RequirementsRequirements:  Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Electrical, Electronics, Computer Engineering or any related engineering field Good programming skills; C/C++ knowledge will be an added advantage Solid analytical problem-solving skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills Good understanding of semiconductor device physics will be an added advantage Knowledge of Unix/Linux environment will be an added advantage

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesDescription: As a Global FE Capital Manager in company, you will be responsible for supervising and developing the Global FE Capital team. You will be responsible for leading the team to manage the capital budgeting and funding process, capital budget saving business process and reuse business process. In this role, you will work closely with Manufacturing Central Team resources, Fab resources, Global Procurement and Finance. You need to have good communication and presentation skills, and able to provide clear and qualitative data analysis for the higher management to support decision making. You should possess detailed understanding on capital expenditures, identifying opportunities for capital optimization and providing benchmarking.   Responsibilities: •Manage overall capital inputs, reports, and tracking •Coordinate the Monthly Capital business process while continuing to improve the process. •Supervise the Capital tracking process and explore opportunities to optimize capital usage •Coaching and mentoring Capital Engineers to reach their goals and potential. •Deliver results by encouraging teamwork and setting priorities. •Manage, facilitate and measure projects to ensure deliverables and timelines are met. •Build trust-based relationships within the team and across organizations. •Ensure that proper business processes are met. •Conduct performance management and professional development of the team. •Ensure proper and efficient change management is maintained. •Develop, communicate and manage area performance goals with personnel and the manager. •Promote and enable a safe and positive working environment.
job_requirements: RequirementsRequirements: •Bachelors Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or Mathematics. •Minimum 5 years experience in Engineering or combination of related operational, engineering or planning is required. •Strong ability to perform data analysis and problem solving. •Strong data validation skills and reporting skills •Ability to map relevant conclusions to support decisions making. •Ability to work closely and effectively with others in a team environment. •Strong verbal communication and presentation skills. •Exceptional customer focus. •Knowledge and practical application of statistics, data analysis and problem solving.

In this role, you will work closely with Manufacturing Central Team resources, Fab resources, Global Procurement and Finance. You need to have good communication and presentation skills, and able to provide clear and qualitative data analysis for the higher management to support decision making. You should possess detailed understanding on capital expenditures, identifying opportunities for capital optimization and providing benchmarking. Responsibilities   •Generate Biweekly and Monthly Capital cashflow update to leadership based on MOR, Scenarios and Projects activities. •Consolidate the request from Sites on the capital budgeting and funding requests and thereby facilitating the approval meeting. •Drive capex saving projects across all sites to meet the capex reduction target. •Continuously look for opportunities to improve on capital business process. •Drive global reuse meetings across all sites and improve the processes to identify the excess assets and facilitate the best possible ways to dispose them. •Identity reuse opportunities within company or from external source for potential capital savings and guide site team members throughout the life cycle of equipment reuse.

Send out periodic reports on process metrics.    Participate in process and yield improvement projects and manage multiple projects.    Partner with production and engineering ops team to determine and implement corrective actions for deviations.    Provide guides, procedures and checklists for maintenance, equipment or process qualification, and reaction mechanisms.    Apply technical knowledge and judgment in data analysis and conducting experiment.    Able to implement process monitoring and control methodologies.    Defining the process margin with respect to upstream and downstream steps    Improving the process cost of ownership, throughput, and performance    Reducing scrap and deviations    Train and mentor technician or engineer to perform specific job tasks    All team members are required to complete their learning items within the stipulated time frame    For business process and/or QMS component that one is responsible or accountable for:    a) ensuring the QMS/business process that is effective and conforms to requirements    b) ensuring that the processes are delivering their intended outputs    c) reporting on QMS/business process performance and opportunities for improvement to management    d) ensuring the promotion of internal and external customer focus throughout the organization    e) ensuring the maintenance of the integrity of the QMS/ business process when changes are planned and implemented.    f) ensuring customer requirements are met

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesCircles.Life is Asia’s first and most successful digital telco and we are on a mission to re-imagine the mobile experience for the digital consumer and disrupt the multi-trillion dollar industry. We launched our services in 2016 and have been rapidly gaining market share while delivering best in class customer experience. We are leading the market in innovation, customer satisfaction and growth.  We have an opening for a ​Business Analyst ​who wants to gain valuable experience and exposure in a hyper-growth environment in Singapore.  Do you want to get first-hand insights on how a hyper-growth company operates?  Are you interested in being part of a fun, energetic team that thrives in an entrepreneurial tech environment?  If the answer is ​YES​, read on to find out more about the role at Circles.Life!  Responsibilities Circles.Life is looking for a ​Business Analyst who possess superior analytical skills, energy, drive and attention to details. The successful candidate will be responsible for analyzing and organizing big data as well as management reporting duties.  As a key member of our team, your responsibilities include:  ●  Working together with various Business Units (including Product, Marketing, Engineering etc.) to understand their analytics and reporting requirements  ●  Creating and implementing various reports from Big Data Platforms and handling Business / Data Analysis as required  ●  Handling various project management for every Business Unit’s analysis and working with our Big Data Team to implement those requirements.  ●  Ensuring a high-level of data integrity and data assurance when working on various data-sets  ●  Working as a single point-of-contact and taken a self-driven and process oriented approach to various requirements  What’s on offer  Circles.Life provides a great environment and platform for employees to build their career. In this role, you can expect:  ●  Unique opportunity to be a part of the digital disruption in telecommunication (Circles.Life is the only company of its kind in all of Asia!)  ●  Autonomy in the role and in managing your own portfolio  ●  Exposure to the fast-paced world of high-tech start-ups  ●  Attractive experience and compensation  ● Working with passionate, smart and driven colleagues in a vibrant environment
job_requirements: RequirementsMust Have  -  BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics or similar field from a reputable university  -  Strong knowledge in advanced SQL concepts with experience working with Big Data Query engines (Hive, Spark, Athena etc.)  -  Experience or knowledge in basic statistical and analytical techniques  -  Knowledge in working with Data Visualisation tools (Metabase, Redash, Tableau etc.)  -  Basic knowledge in Python  Nice to Have  -  Javascript knowledge (D3JS etc.)  -  Knowledge in Shell scripting

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesCompany overview: Google is not a conventional company, and we don’t intend to become one. True, we share attributes with the world’s most successful organizations – a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind – but even as we continue to grow, we’re committed to retaining a small-company feel. At Google, we know that every employee has something important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. We provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary, bonus, and equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. Googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. For more information, visit www.google.com/careers. The area: Trust and Safety At Google we work hard to earn our users’ trust every day. Gaining and retaining this trust is critically important to Google’s success. We defend Google's integrity by fighting spam, fraud and abuse, and develop and communicate state-of-the-art product policies. The Trust and Safety team reduces risk and protects the experience of our users and business partners in more than 40 languages and across Google's expanding base of products. We work with a variety of teams from Engineering to Legal, Public Policy and Sales Engineering to set policies and combat fraud and abuse in a scalable way, often with an eye to finding industry-wide solutions. Trust and Safety team members are motivated to find innovative solutions, and use technical know-how, user insights and proactive communication to pursue the highest possible quality and safety standards for users across Google products. The role: Trust and Safety Analyst, Shopping (English, Mandarin) - Singapore Google's brand is only as strong as our users' trust--and their steadfast belief that our guiding principles are what's best for them. Our Trust and Safety team has the critical responsibility of protecting Google's users by ensuring online safety by fighting web abuse and fraud across Google products like Search, Maps, Google Ads and AdSense. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic leader. You understand the user's point of view and are passionate about using your combined technical, sales and customer service acumen to protect our users. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google developers and Product Managers to navigate challenging online safety situations and handle abuse and fraud cases at Google speed (read: fast!). Help us prove that quality on the Internet trumps all. Additional Role Description: The mission of Trust and Safety Shopping team is to provide safe and high quality user experience at Google Shopping. We do this by removing/preventing ads which violate Google Shopping ads policies or Product data specifications.   As a Lead Strategist, you will provide subject matter expertise oversight to review operations, and you will identify gaps in policies/enforcement. You will also collaborate closely within the global Trust and Safety team as well as cross functional teams such as Product Management, Engineering, Legal to roll out new enforcement solutions/processes. Responsibilities: - Prevent spam and abuse at Google Shopping. Investigate and analyse seller abuse. - Provide a high-quality experience to our users by ensuring the product data provided to Google is accurate, up to date, and compliant with Google shopping Product data specification. - Manage multi-stakeholder high impact, risk business processes and escalations. - Pull data and perform statistical data analysis to identify patterns and trends. - Develop well argued and data driven proposals to improve user experience, solve abuse trends/gaps and improve efficiency and effectiveness of workflow/processes.
job_requirements: RequirementsMinimum qualifications: - Bachelor’s degree in Science or Engineering or equivalent practical experience. - Ability to speak and write in English and Mandarin fluently and idiomatically. Preferred qualifications: - Masters degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics or related field. - Experience at helping improve purchase experience through high quality product data. - Fraud/abuse fighting experience in e-retail platforms. - Knowledge of querying and database structures.
job_title: Trust and Safety Analyst, Shopping (English, Mandarin) - Singapore

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesPosition Summary: Be part of an international US Based company to help building a state of the art Design and Development capability in Singapore. If you have experience in the LED Development and Optics or Equipment industry, come with an engineering background and want to get things started we are looking for you. Fresh graduates with relevant experience may also apply. Responsibilities:  Develop and improve LED module design with optical and thermal management, including simulation and analysis for LED module development meeting the design criteria  and performance targets Research and investigate appropriate technologies in electronics,  LED and UV lamp power management, noise filtering and other relevant design aspects of UV curing equipment Conducting critical design analysis and simulations of complex systems and sub-systems of equipment. Create and maintain engineering data, documentation and collateral that achieves project deliverables and supports a product, such as, electrical drawings, schematics, functional block diagrams, detailed technical specifications, functional requirements documents, software requirements, component datasheets, project schedules & tasks lists, engineering analysis & simulation reports, and design verification test plans and reports. Perform classical engineering analysis on designs and concepts using mathematics, conventional scientific methods or use of software simulations.   Understand and optimize tasks related to automated and manual SMT assembly processes including monitor and adjust process parameter for yield and quality Run Data analysis tools such as JMP, Minitab and Excel for process optimization
job_requirements: RequirementsSkills/Qualifications:  Bachelor or Masters in Mechanical, Optical or Electronics Engineering, other technical field like Physics 1-3 years experience in Design and Product Development, In-depth technical understanding of Optics and LED Technology with design and process, including hands-on working experience of LED and Optics Experience with relevant engineering and analysis software like (Autocad, Tracepro, Matlab, Minitab, Solidworks and others) Experience in settling up optical systems including test and measurement stages Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Excellent interpersonal skills Experience with Project Management and stage gate principles Good business acumen and judgement And able to work in a fast paced start up environment Experience with vendor management and Tool selection Self-starter with strong personal work ethic. Must have a "let’s get it done" attitude. Able to make individual contributions, and stay focused on the goals of the group and able to adjust to changing priorities and schedules and thrives in high-pressure, deadline-oriented environment. Strong attention to details and problem solving abilities.

Ability to analyze and apply statistical methods. Effective verbal and written communication skills.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesSquarepoint is a global investment management firm that utilizes a diversified portfolio of systematic and quantitative strategies across financial market that seeks to achieve high quality, uncorrelated returns for our clients. We have deep expertise in trading, technology and operations and attribute our success to rigorous scientific research. As a technology and data-driven firm, we design and build our own cutting-edge systems, from high performance trading platforms to large scale data analysis and compute farms. With main investment offices in New York, London and Singapore, we emphasize true, global collaboration by aligning our investment, technology and operations teams functionally around the world.    Overview of Quantitative Analyst Position:   Research and implement strategies within the firm's automated trading framework.  Analyze large data sets using advanced statistical methods to identify trading opportunities. Develop a strong understanding of market structure of various exchanges and asset classes.    Typical day of Quantitative Analyst:   Primary focus throughout the day is on researching and implementing trading ideas.  Before market open, check that all required data and related processes are ready for the trading day. During market hours, sporadically monitor behaviour and performances strategies.
job_requirements: RequirementsSkills Set Required For Position:   Quantitative background - includes degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Financial Engineering, Operations Research, Computer Science and Physics. Programming proficiency with at least one major programming on scripting language (e.g. C++, Java, Python). Strong communication skills and ability to work well with colleagues across multiple regions.  Ability to work well under pressure. Successfully developing and implementing systematic strategies.       *Applicant are also required to apply through the company website http://www.squarepoint-capital.com/

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWe are seeking a highly motivated candidate with relevant expertise to support a research project involving biomarker discoveries, epigenetics and pathways related to behavioural and psychological traits. He or she is expected to be able to independently design and carry out wet-lab experiments, implement data quality control, perform data analysis and interpretation. The work will involve techniques such as SNP genotyping, DNA sequencing, RNA expression studies, real-time PCR analysis or Taqman assays, methylation analysis, hormone assays, GWAS or genome-wide analyses, etc. Data analysis using statistical tools such as STATA and SPSS will be used. The successful candidate should also be able to assist in supervising students, report writing and presentation.
job_requirements: RequirementsCandidate should have a BSc(Hons)  or MSc degree in life sciences or related science disciplines with both lab and data analysis experience. Appointment at Research Fellow level requires a PhD degree in life sciences, or combined psychology and life sciences background. Wet lab experience in the above areas is a pre-requisite for this  appointment regardless of academic background.

job_requirements: Requirements Bachelor’s Degree in Life Sciences, Food Science, Human Nutrition or related fields Ability to work with a group of scientists with diverse range of disciplines Competent in computer skills and/ proficient in instrumentation and food analysis Possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills Meticulous and organised with the ability to multi-task Able to work independently as well as a team player    The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Role: As a Senior Analyst for Platts, you will deliver in-depth analyses of global naphtha markets. You will explore the interface between refinery-supplied naphtha, natural gasoline, and condensate to provide actionable intelligence to clients, enabling them to make informed trading, risk management, and investment decisions around this rapidly evolving market. The Location: Houston, Singapore The Team: We are a global team. We are dynamic, with rapidly growing ways of delivering important content and analytics to our readers. For many, we are essential because of the quality insights that we provide. The Impact: Senior Naphtha Analyst, you will be a critical member of the Analytics Team, responsible for conducting market or statistical analysis and interpreting key supply, demand and trade flow data into actionable information for our clients. You will build out detailed, new analytical reports and models that will empower our clients to make business decisions based on strong fundamental analyses. Your role will focus on strengthening the coverage within our current product portfolio, as well as broadening our reach into related commodities.  Speed to market will be critical along with making the reports and analysis crisp, impactful and tradable. You will also be part of a cross commodity team that ensures consistency in outlook across petrochemicals, refined products and NGLs. What We’re Looking For: Naphtha, Natural Gas Liquids, Condensate, Crude Oil, Chemical Engineering, Process Design, Petrochemicals, Financial and/or financial modeling, Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook), Research What’s in it for you:  You will ensure all naphtha market analysis is relevant and delivered in a timely and impactful way to our customers. You will provide the vision for development of new naphtha analytics coverage and ensure consistency in forecasts for naphtha, pentanes and condensate across the downstream markets. You will represent the S&P Global Platts Analytics view on naphtha markets to customers. You will be expected to present at external conferences to promote our petrochemical analysis and build the Platts Analytics brand in the petrochemical industry. You will be a key member of the Platts Analytics Team  Responsibilities:  Collect global supply/demand fundamentals and economic data for naphtha and related products to leverage this information, along with knowledge of other feedstocks, cracker yields and marginal pricing into a global naphtha market outlook via commentary and written analysis. Develop regional supply/demand models which appropriately depict the historical relationships between naphtha and related products as well as forecast the interplay of these products in the global market. Utilize your broad scope of knowledge to perform analysis on data sets that may require advanced modeling techniques. Conduct research including identification of data, data input, and statistical analysis of results in order to build and maintain data, generate rate of return analysis, and compile reports. Design presentations and engage directly with clients to present actionable data analysis and insights. Act quickly to meet each client request.
job_requirements: RequirementsBasic Qualifications:  BA/BS (preferred focus Chemical Engineering, Business, Mathematics, Economics, Finance, and/or related field of study. 5-10 years of experience in NGL or petrochemicals industry. Natural curiosity about energy market fundamentals and a love for technical clarity. Strong numeracy including the ability to conceptualize proportional relationships, understand the basic principles of algebra and statistics; and an understanding of how to apply basic math functions in Excel. Excel - proficiency with SQL queries, pivot tables, VLOOKUP, modeling, and linear regressions. Experience with R and Matlab are useful. Powerpoint – strong experience and proficiency with crafting presentations that show data graphically (charts, tables). Well-rounded communication skills including solid listening techniques, clear, concise writing styles; and strong verbal skills.  A technical test will be administered during the interview process. S&P Global Platts At S&P Global Platts, we provide the insights; you make better informed trading and business decisions with confidence. We’re the leading independent provider of information and benchmark prices for the commodities and energy markets. Customers in over 150 countries look to our expertise in news, pricing and analytics to deliver greater transparency and efficiency to markets. S&P Global Platts coverage includes oil and gas, power, petrochemicals, metals, agriculture and shipping. S&P Global Platts is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. For more information, visit www.platts.com. S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer committed to making all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, gender, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, marital status (including domestic partnerships and civil unions), sexual orientation, military veteran status, unemployment status, or other legally protected categories, subject to applicable law. To all recruitment agencies; S&P does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward such resumes to any S&P Global employee, office location or website. S&P Global will not be responsible for any fees related to such resumes.

Our innovation has brought us the support of leading Venture Capital Funds from Silicon Valley and Singapore. MySQL, Hadoop ecosystem and etcs  We offer:  Be a part of an award winning, fast growing FinTech company that value friendly working atmosphere Contribute to ambitious projects using and developing the latest technologies Take the opportunity for professional development in Singapore as well as Poland & USA Benefit from the attractive Employee Stock Ownership Plan Take part in regular get-togethers, including seasonal parties, international meetings etc. Get access to the newest ideas and concepts by attending top Tech/IT conferences, meetups and networking events!    Please send your CV to jm@silenteight.com. Lead and manage pilot(s) of surveys and focus group discussions  3. Draft research reports/articles to inform policy making and improve practice, and to publish in recognized platforms  4. Conduct presentations to stakeholders and promote the dissemination of research findings  5. Assist with other research work such as:  a. Collect, clean, and perform preliminary data analysis  b. Manage vendors performing data collection, and monitor their data collection progress and rigour  c. Prepare specified sections of research articles, reports and presentations  d. Coordinate project updates for management reporting  e. Conduct presentations to key stakeholders  f. Coordinate research dissemination plans and activities  g. Follow-up to support stakeholders seeking to apply the research findings to actionable plans  h. Procure required services  i. Develop and produce publications relating to the research conducted    Requirements:   A tertiary qualification in Education / Social Science / Economics / Statistics / Psychology (Behavioral Science). Candidates with post-graduate research-based qualifications will have an added advantage.  At least 5 years of working experience, preferably in relevant research or policy area. A research background involving Item Response Theory (IRT) or machine learning, big data analysis or text analytics would be an advantage.  Experience in conducting empirical qualitative and/or quantitative research preferred.  An interest in pursuing empirical research in the field of skills, productivity and performance, including, but not limited to, skills strategies, impact of skills, returns on skills and training, how skills are used at work, relationship between skills and work/performance, skills proficiency and socio-economic and business outcomes.  High level ability to think in the abstract and conceptualize from literature and empirical data.  A willingness to learn and explore ideas and explore ideas/tools will be a desirable quality.  Proven ability to write and document research findings and prepare research reports for publication.  Capability to work confidently with other researchers, and engage stakeholders and the CET community.  Ability to work both autonomously and as part of a team.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Impact You Will Have: The Research Manager is responsible for structuring and leading research investigations to support leader development programs design and thought leadership publications events. The Research Manager will conduct primary research to understand client challenges and identify novel solutions. Supplementing primary research with surveys, secondary research, and public and proprietary data analysis, the Research Manager will form and test hypotheses that challenge the conventional wisdom regarding producing successful leaders. The Research Manager will work with other members of the organization to translate research findings into innovation leadership development programs, white papers, content marketing, and client event materials. The Research Manager will also support the development of novel client learning experiences and leadership support tools.   A Day in the Life:  Design and execute research studies based on the executive strategy and annual research agenda of our company. Design and deploy survey instruments and other data collection tools to build proprietary data sets. Conduct direct, primary research with industry and business leaders, as well as members of their teams, to collect qualitative information. Conduct secondary research, such as literature reviews, data analysis, etc. Create the prototype for the new technical user experience (i.e., artificial intelligence) for our client engagement tools for leadership challenges. Develop thought leadership inputs, including problem statements, root cause diagrams, conventional wisdom inventories, and hypothesis documents. Write thought leadership pieces for content marketing, including value proposition and competitor differentiation information. Contribute to leadership development programs and events Contribute to the creation of unique client development experiences

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesA.                  Areas of Responsibility – The incumbent is responsible to co-ordinate the regulatory affairs and compliance activities for all products produced throughout the world when relate to product, process and labelling. Assist and coordinate with the regulatory authorities about acceptable claims, wordings, performance data and other information requisite for marketing the products.  Participate and assist to provide material / information required by Regulatory Authority for import, reimbursement and product registration. Participate in company vigilance system including product recall activity, assisting in assessing the recall class of the recall and assuring that regulatory components of the recall are understood and complied.  Coordinate with each department and provide required documentation and gain approval for recalls / withdrawals.  Assist compliance to Equipment Qualification / Validation Program, Process and Method validation. Assist to finalize and set up the specification for approved starting raw and packaging materials, bulk solutions and finished products that meet the relevant standard and requirements. Participate and assist for establishment, verification and implementation of all company procedures to comply with cGMP and ISO requirement. Exercises responsibility for employee cGMP training such as employee orientation, Quality Awareness, and Job Training. Exercises responsibility for monitoring and control of the manufacturing process, environment and Plant hygiene including clean rooms.  Any other tasks or projects that are being assigned by the immediate supervisor, as and when required. Sustain and Active Quality Management System, such as Management Review, Internal Audit, CAPA and training. Apply appropriate auditing methodologies (sampling techniques, following audit trails, investigations, reporting etc.) Post-marketing review activities such as Customer complaints, feedback and survey. Track and analysis of quality data for non-conformance, CAPA and Change Control. Lead teams in conducting investigations related to non-conformance and /or customer complaints. Update the product technical files including risk analysis and product review. Update the relevant standard, regulatory guideline and essential requirement. Ensure documentation system comply with cGMP and ISO requirement. Author, review and/or approve documentation as required Standard Operating Procedures(SOPs), applicable deviation reports for testing, machine equipment and process related deviations etc). Co-ordinate to update Master list for all documentation. Validation plan, Calibration Program and product/ Material code. Make sure only approved supplier and approved material are used in manufacturing process. Monitor and evaluate the performance of suppliers to comply with cGMP and ISO requirement. Make sure product and material storage condition comply with the requirements of cGMP requirement and relevant standard.  Make sure production methods comply with the requirements of cGMP requirement, relevant standard and SOP. Reject, rework and dispose of Non-conforming material and product. Co-ordinate design control approvals which associated with R&D activities, new product introductions or significant product changes. Assist on the standard and regulatory correctness of labelling, including promotional material. Make sure that permanent, temporary and emergency changes to production facilities are not compromised to existing product quality and prevent new hazards and risk from being introduced into the process so that the integrity of the quality control system is maintained. B.                  Challenges of Position – The position requires the incumbent to be self-motivated to keep up with the current practices and independent decision-making. C.                  Communication Network – The incumbent must be able to communicate with his/her staffs to ensure understanding and compliance of work tasks. D.                  Measurement – The incumbent will be measured by success in achieving good QA and Regulatory affairs’ KPIs. E.                   Requirements (minimum qualification and competencies) – Diploma/Degree in Science (Biology, Chemistry, Pharmaceutical). Scientifically, materials, products and process evaluation or validation required by rules and regulations with relevant education and experience. In-depth knowledge of the cGMP, US FDA QSR and 21 CFR, EU MDD, ISO standards such as ISO 9001, ISO 13485. Demonstrated success in preparation of regulatory marketing submission to HSA, EU and other regulatory agencies. Working knowledge of data analysis techniques and product performance testing. Understanding of law, regulation and pending regulation. Understands competitive product features in comparison to products.  Provides statistical analysis for evaluation of processes.  Knowledge of basic technology employed by the business such as BFS technology, API aseptic manufacturing. Equipment and utility IQ/OQ/PQ/PV.  Identifying, writing evaluating and closing OOS’s and investigations. Leadership caliber. Gather metric information to use for continuous improvement in areas of responsibility.  Simplifying strategy into specific actions with clear accountability, making decisions with speed and accuracy based on best available information and communicating priorities clearly and concisely whilst under crisis situations to ensure compliance.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAmazon is looking for a passionate and talented Program Manager supporting Prime Now operation in Singapore and will be responsible for Supply Chain.  As a member of the Supply Chain team, you will have an opportunity to be a thought leader in Amazon Supply Chain.  You will use your blend of analysis and program management skills to strategically plan and tactically manage capacity of our network. You thrive in a constantly evolving business environment and work well with stakeholders across the business teams. You are able to analyze large data sets quickly in identifying complex patterns and relationships resulting in solutions to real business problems. This role offers an opportunity to drive and influence business-critical decisions that will keep the costs to the minimum while we continue to delight our customer.  Responsibilities · Design, develop and establish metrics to monitor, analyze and provide strategic insights to drive growth and performance · Perform complex data analysis to identify different opportunities to reduce costs and/or improve customer experience and set priorities to improve them. · Collaborate with business and cross functional teams to identify process and system improvement opportunities · Lead an effective S&OP with cross functional teams to develop an optimized plan for operations · Inventory Management and Capacity Planning · Enable cross border transshipments of inventory
job_requirements: RequirementsBasic qualifications · Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain Management, Engineering, or other technical field from an accredited university or 5+ years experience · Familiarity with Supply Chain Management concepts, e.g., forecasting, planning, optimization, and logistics · Advanced knowledge of Excel is required · Excellent written and verbal communication skills complemented with the ability to problem solve independently · 3 - 5 years of work experience with the design and use of complex supply chain software systems Preferred Qualifications MBA and work experience in a Supply Chain field is highly desired  A successful candidate will also demonstrate:  · High attention to detail including proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously · Data driven decision making mentality and sound business judgment · Ability to think strategically and execute methodically · Ability to work in a fast-paced environment where continuous innovation is desired · Committed to learning and expanding professional and technical knowledge · Demonstrated analytical and quantitative skills and ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions and develop business cases · Ability to clearly communicate data insights to others · Willingness to roll up your sleeves and do whatever is necessary; general manager / owner mentality · Demonstrated ability to dive deep in understanding the product, our business, and the competitive landscape · Start-up attitude and ability to flex to help identify and solve quickly emerging opportunities
