job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesCommercial Manager – (Bauxite & Alumina) Location: Singapore   Opportunity to work in a world class organization within the aluminium business    Key position in driving commercial strategies into fruition    Great position with strong career visibility and growth potential     Rio Tinto is a leading global mining and metals group that focuses on finding, mining, processing and marketing the earth's mineral resources. We have been in business for more than 140 years and remain focused on the long term. We're committed to sustainable and innovative ways to do business, deliver results and build a great work environment. It's how we grow - it's how you grow. We are a diverse team of talented, enthusiastic individuals who foster a culture of inclusion. No matter how they may differ, our people share one thing in common. It’s a belief that work is more rewarding when we are accepted and valued for our differences, not judged by them. We all have something to contribute, and it’s this contribution that makes for a great organisation and fulfilling career  The Opportunity  We are looking for a Commercial Manager – Bauxite & Alumina role based in Singapore to deliver, execute and support the Bauxite & Alumina sales & marketing strategy. These activities are fundamental to our industry leading market position, the bauxite & alumina business growth, the overall business’ success and therefore value generation.   Bauxite and Alumina (B&A) is accountable for Rio Tinto Alcan’s worldwide activities related to bauxite mining and refining into smelter-grade alumina. The business unit employs approximately 6,000 people (incl. JVs, excl. contractors) in ten countries and owns and/or operates four bauxite mines and deposits and six smelter-grade alumina plants.  B&A is a recognized leader and supplier of alumina refinery technology and has an extensive project pipeline which includes the expansion of operations in Australia and potential future development in many other countries.   What the Role Entails  This role is a great opportunity for the successful candidate to have direct influence and leadership in sales and marketing activities regarding our Bauxite and Alumina commercial business.  Managing and developing the value enhancing customer centric delivery while bringing in strategic thoughts and dynamism to the role which is integral to the overall success of RT group. Reporting to the General Manager, Commercial Bauxite & Alumina, you will be:  Executing and enhancing marketing strategies for maximum value. Leading/supporting to ensure individual commercial deals/contracts/transactions are appropriately evaluated and clearly align with the overall market strategy.  Analyses deals / contracts / transactions to confirm value proposition and provide risk assessment of each deal. Assessing data and market intelligence from market analysis, market, competitors, customer downstream processors and apply these in an innovative manner. Supporting and contributing to the sales and marketing activities of bauxite including leading and coordinating bauxite market development work in the Pacific.  As part of the market development activities, working closely with Bauxite &Alumina’s technical marketing team to identify and define the customers’ need with a view to better serve them and further develop bauxite market opportunities.  Supporting and contributing to the sales and marketing activities of alumina with a view to sell/purchase alumina on spot, short-term or long-term basis in order to ensure that the group keeps a globally balanced alumina book and to consistently secure alumina for RTA’s aluminium smelters.  Continuously to explore alumina supply opportunities to RTA with new potential suppliers or producers to create additional value Leading and managing business relationship and sales account with certain bauxite & alumina customers/suppliers as required. Providing support to bauxite sales in China and in Atlantic if and as required.  Keeping and managing the global commercial alumina balance, review any position at risk and taking or recommending appropriate commercial actions.  As part of the sales & marketing activities, supporting and participating to certain commercial & price negotiations of bauxite & alumina transactions including delivering the work associated with the preparation & pre-negotiation process (market update, market data analysis, pricing options review, negotiation strategy, etc.) and the post-negotiation work and process with customers/suppliers as well as internal stakeholders. Working and collaborating with B&A Commercial’s logistics, scheduling, contract administration team, Rio Tinto Marine and operations sites from times to times as required.
job_requirements: RequirementsWhat you will need for this role To succeed in this role, you will have:   Bachelor Degree and/or MBA in a relevant discipline    At least 10 years of relevant and progressive commercial experience, and comfortable working across both strategic and execution levels.     Proven abilities in navigating and operating successfully in a matrix organization, with stakeholders’ engagement and business partnering skills being key requisites.     Proven experience in deriving and introducing innovative commercial strategies, overcoming hurdles and driving them successfully into revenue generation.    Ability to use basic technical/engineering/chemical/financial knowledge in order to be able to understand customer processes, behavior, costs, products/markets and discuss value in use matters.   Ability to leverage on established bauxite and alumina customer/supplier relationships and turning them into advantageous short/long term positioning for the business.    Strong bauxite, alumina & aluminum processing knowledge    It will also be beneficial if you have:    Strong language abilities in French or Mandarin Chinese, due to supporting business needs   Prior experience working in a commodities trading house in tandem to a traditional mining company      So if this sounds like you and the opportunity you are looking for, apply now before 7th November 2018.  Please note, in order to be successfully considered for this role you must complete all pre-screening questions. If you would like to know more about careers at Rio Tinto, you can like us on Facebook, follow us on Twitter or join us on LinkedIn.

job_description: Roles & Responsibilities   One Research Fellow position is currently available in the School of Physical and Mathematical Science, NTU.     Excellent knowledge in chemical synthesis, optics, photophysics of semiconductors, charge and quasi-particle dynamics, charge transfer mechanisms, femtosecond lasers, and femtosecond laser spectroscopy is essential. A written and oral test of the candidate’s technical competency of photophysics concepts and ultrafast optical spectroscopy basics will be conducted during the interview.  Excellent knowledge in the synthesis of halide perovskite materials (including nanostructures) and the fabrication of perovskite solar cells devices.  Excellent knowledge in photonics, photonics microcavities and polaritonic systems is essential. To synthesize, prepare and process perovskite nanomaterials. To operate, optimize, troubleshoot and maintain femtosecond laser systems To setup and align optical beamlines/setups for transient optical spectroscopy experiments.   To conduct ultrafast optical spectroscopy studies of novel semiconductors and emergent semiconductor nanostructures. To perform data analysis and data interpretation of transient optical spectroscopy experiments independently To assist the principal investigator with the writing of research papers. To assist the principal investigator in the supervision and mentoring of a small research team comprising of post-graduate students and undergraduate students. Be familiar with the use of cryogenic systems for low-temperature optical spectroscopy measurements.
job_requirements: Requirements Candidate must possess at least a BSc 1st Class/2nd Class Upper Honours Degree in Physics or Chemistry or Chemical Sciences. PhD candidates who are about to submit their thesis for examination or have submitted their thesis for defence are also welcome to apply. Critical Requirement: Candidate must have a minimum 3 Years of Research Experience in Ultrafast Lasers and Ultrafast Laser Spectroscopy of organic-inorganic halide perovskites. Critical Requirement: Candidate must also have a minimum 3 Years of Research Experience in the synthesis of halide perovskite materials (including nanostructures); and in processing, fabrication and characterization of organic-inorganic halide perovskite solar cells. Sound chemistry knowledge in the synthesis of perovskite nanomaterials and in the photophysics knowledge in the ultrafast optical spectroscopy field. Experienced in conducting ultrafast optical spectroscopy experiments and data analysis independently. Ability to conceptualize and communicate major elements of experimental design and results to other staffs, managements, and visitors. Knowledge of scientific or engineering software like Labview, Mathematica, Matlab, AutoDesk, Lab Talk, LaTex will be an added advantage.  An effective team player with good communication & interpersonal skills. Ability to work in a team as well as independently without supervision. Able to work under intense pressure and meet tight deadlines.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Summary: The computational biology group at the Singapore Institute for Clinical Sciences (SICS) invites applications for a Research Fellow position in the area of Metabolomics and Lipidomics Bioinformatics. The successful candidate will join an established research team focusing on understanding molecular and biomedical data from observational and interventional clinical studies.   Job Responsibilities:   Perform statistical analysis for metabolomics/lipidomics projects within Systems Biology group. Apply bioinformatics algorithms, unsupervised and supervised methods, univariate and multivariate regression analysis, etc. to enable the discovery of predictive and prognostic biomarkers and biomarker signatures utilizing metabolomics, phenotypic and other omics data from pregnancy and birth cohorts studied at SICS. Work on multiple projects involving a diverse and interdisciplinary team of scientists across multiple laboratories. Develops and implement standardized analysis plans for data analysis and quality control for metabolomics, and other large data sets from collaborations with PIs leading clinical and observational studies. Write manuscripts and project reports. Prepare and present data for publication in conferences/meetings. Stay updated with the literature and engage in discussions related to ongoing proposed projects.
job_requirements: Requirements Ph.D. degree or industry training in metabolomics/lipidomics field. Proficiency in analysing data acquired from GC-MS and LC-MS platforms. Previous handling of clinical data and statistical approaches to perform association studies. Track record of productive research in metabolomics field, evidenced by peer-reviewed publication record. Aptitude for and experience of collaborative research. Strong computational skills to independently analyze data with standard statistical tools and methods. Ability to multi-task and work in an environment with tight timelines and multiple priorities. Excellent oral and written communication skills to interact with colleagues and technical support.    The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Apple is now seeking a Senior Forensic Auditor/Fraud Investigations Analyst in Singapore to plan, develop, and perform audits and investigations to ensure compliance with Apple’s policies and procedures. The role will also involve assessment and development of Apple’s policies and procedures; education of Service partners; communication of findings to Service partners and Apple Senior Management; and identification and recovery of improperly paid amounts.  -  Plan and conduct AppleCare Compliance audits -  Develop standard and ad-hoc reports for Compliance analysis and provide recommendations to management based on data analysis performed. -  Identify and assess fraud and service related risks. -  Develop and implement prioritized audit plans based on risk. -  Consult with business management on risks and controls -  Independently evaluate the reliability and integrity of AppleCare's control environment, including security and other business controls for new and existing systems, policies and procedures. -  Consult with management on policies and procedures; maintain relationship and related engagements with business management, Internal Audit, Legal, Global Security and third parties.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesA research officer position is available to apply mass cytometry for the broad profiling of mouse and human immune cell subsets. With access to unique clinical samples and a broad range of analysis techniques, at SIgN, we are studying the role of immune cells in immune responses to infectious disease and/or cancer by looking for correlates/predictors of disease status/progression. As a major part of these studies, we are focusing on the use and further development of single-cell mass spectrometry-based (mass cytometry or “Cytometry by Time-Of-flight” – CyTOF, See Bendall et al., Science 2011, Newell et al., Immunity 2012, Becher et al. Nat. Immunol. 2014, Wong et al. Cell Reports 2015). This method is being used for many different projects in a variety of settings. Job Description:   Preparation of proteins and reagents Human and mouse blood/tissue sample handling and processing Operation and maintenance of the CyTOF machine Data analysis and interpretation Help with lab tasks such as ordering and lab maintenance

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Singapore Branch is a Wholesale Banking Branch, offering a full suite of world class financial products and services. The Singapore Branch also serves as the Bank’s regional office in Asia Pacific, providing financial services to both companies as well as financial institutions, and also seeks to leverage on the trade corridor spanning from Asia to the Middle East and Africa. Job Purpose:  This role is responsible for assisting the Head of HR in the efficient day-to-day HR generalist functions for Singapore Branch and Representative Offices as well as supporting all aspects of human resources work.To support and project manage assigned regional Asia strategic projects and to undertake HR data and analysis that add value to strategic decisions. This includes recruitment, employee relations,compensation, benefits, training, as well as the administration of human resources policies, procedures, and programs. Key Accountabilities:  General HR Activities:  Administer staff on-boarding and exit process with local management and HO HR team.  Management of staff medical claims, insurance matters and leave records.  Assist in on-going review and implementation of HR policies and SOPs.  Assist with recruitment activities for the Branch.  Management of Agency Contract staff (recruitment and invoices).  Ensure employees’ details are maintained and updated accurately on timely manner.  Support the Branch’s training and development initiatives. Assist to source appropriate external training programs for staff.  Assist in training administration – enrolment, logistics, training evaluation and training claim submissions.  Assist in government and related bodies’ surveys (MOM and MAS).  Assist in employee relations matters.  Assist in general HR Operational support.  Assist to organize staff activities – staff birthday celebration, Stars in a Box recognition awards, employee engagement initiatives.  Assist in preparing reports, letters and documents as and when required.  Assist with management of the reception including mails & deliveries in the absence of the receptionist.  Follow all relevant departmental policies, including processes, standard operating procedures so that work is carried out in a controlled and consistent manner.  Proactively seek ways to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of HR operations and procedures.  Undertake ad-hoc projects and duties assigned by Manager. HR Data Analysis and MIS:  Play a pivotal role in designing, executing and measuring the effectiveness of HR programs, which will include identifying issues, forming hypotheses and synthesizing conclusions into recommendations.  Design and undertake research studies that analyse strategic issues challenges faced by FAB Asia so that decision making is well supported by facts and comprehensive analysis.  Develop and analyze monthly employee data, ad-hoc surveys and metrics.  Track trends and developments in assigned functional areas.  Conduct studies, perform research and prepare reports.  Design communication findings and recommendations on critical initiatives  Review, interpret and recommend policy, process or program improvements.  Produce comprehensive, targeted and insightful reports / presentations in Powerpoint and/or Excel that summarize findings and recommendations which supports the senior management decision-making.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAbout RedMart As one of the fastest growing ecommerce companies in Asia, RedMart offers an unparalleled experience scaling a startup. Our culture: entrepreneurial, fiercely intelligent, team oriented, deeply creative and whatever you add to it! We’re fanatic about improving our customer experience and providing “wow” customer service. We're interested in talented, creative and passionate people joining our fantastic team who believe in our mission: To save our customers time and money for the important things in life! Our technology focused “RED Teams” are generally made up of the following roles: product managers, software engineers, data scientists, industrial and process engineers, and analysts. Each team is focused on a specific function of the business (e.g. transport, fulfillment, inventory, discovery, CRM) and faces external customers or specific business stakeholders as “internal customers”. Role Purpose At RedMart we use technology to delight our customers; we innovate to make our customers’ lives better.  As a Product Manager on the Transport RED Team, you will be responsible for working with software and industrial engineers to provide routing, dispatch, geospatial, and telematics software and hardware products and continuously improving operational processes and equipment, all to serve our customers better. Key tasks and responsibilities The primary areas of responsibility of Product Manager – Transport will be to:   Be responsible for delivering on key customer experience, operational and financial KPIs in transport.   Develop and manage effective stakeholder relationships, involvement and expectations with ground operations and third party vendors.   Conduct on-site observations, perform extensive data analysis, and create real-time reports to understand and measure the current operations processes.   Build innovative, high-quality roadmaps based on company and team goals to reduce delivery costs, reduce defects, and improve customer experience.   Manage product backlogs, including prioritizing and balancing tactical and strategic goals, and making correct trade offs between customer experience, operational, financial and technical priorities.   Work closely with product designers, software and industrial engineers to ensure the technical solutions and process optimizations are properly designed, prioritized and delivered on time.   Develop the right communication and training materials to support successful implementation and sustainability of the solutions developed.   Manage projects through the complete life-cycle and deliver sustainable change.   Assess the financial impact of solutions and prepare business cases.   Take a lead program management role on multi-team Transport projects.     Attitude & behaviours critical to success To be successful in this role, you must have a passion for logistics, continuous improvement and an unrelenting customer focus. In addition to focusing on flawless execution you will have high energy, intellectual curiosity and proven track record of delivering results.   You will have demonstrated:   Perseverance. Building a great company that customers love is hard work. Many challenges await and we are looking for team members we can count on when things get tough.   High business Impact. We are results oriented. We value people who focus on the right things and get them done.   Strategic awareness, financial fluency and a strong understanding of a profit and loss account.   Great operational, product and business judgement. Willingness and ability to take smart risks and fail forward.   Clear interest in working closely with RedMart and third party delivery personnel to understand core issues and come up with innovative solutions. job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesSenior Data Scientist The Senior Data Scientist will undertake applied research and development in the areas of data science and biomedical informatics, using the latest technologies in machine learning and distributed computing. The platform and algorithms developed may be used in a range of diagnostic and therapeutic applications, such as sleep disorder breathing, chronic obstructive pulmonary disorder, and other respiratory disorders, as well as co-morbidities such as congestive heart failure and diabetes and chronic disease management Let’s talk about this position: The Advanced Analytics team is headquartered in the United States and is focused on developing analytics solutions that will enable a data-driven approach to addressing business questions. This role will be a part of the Advanced Analytics team in Singapore, and collaborate with the global Advanced Analytics team in support of achieving global and regional business goals. Responsibilities and Accountabilities:  Research, customization, and development of statistical and machine learning algorithms to meet complex project requirements; tasks include defining hypotheses, executing necessary tests and experiments, evaluating, tuning and optimizing algorithms and methods to specific situations. Analysis of big data for data-driven solution validation, evaluation and technology innovation.  Optimize data analysis processes and systems for better efficiency and maintainability. Leading sub-functional and small project teams. Mentoring and training more junior team members and serving as a best-practice resource for statistics and machine learning. Writing of documents that clearly explain how algorithms should be implemented, verified and validated. Writing documents for use in the preparation of intellectual property and technical publications. Monitoring the literature of interest and industrial development trends, broadly in the areas of data analysis and machine learning. Understanding regulatory requirements, such as those mandated by the FDA. Working within the ResMed Quality system, standards and maintaining training requirements. Being ever mindful of the requirements of the wider market and ResMed stakeholders. Promoting safe working environment within OH&S guidelines
job_requirements: RequirementsLet’s talk about you: To really get us excited, you will have a degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Applied Mathmatics, or related fields with minimal 6 years’ industry or academic experience in data science. Post-graduaded research experience (Masters or PhD) in a field encompassing Data Science, Applied Statistics, or Biomedical Informatics and relevant industry experience would be favourably considered. For this role, you should have skills and knowledge such as:  Expert in statistical analysis methods, including analysis of variance, regression, time series analysis, survival analysis, etc. Extensive knowledge in machine learning fundamental theories and data mining technologies. Leadership and hands on experience with development of data analytics systems, including data exploration/crawling, feature engineering, model building, performance evaluation, and online deployment of models. Proficient with server side programming in Python/Java. Hands on experience in handling large and distributed datasets on Hadoop, Spark, Hive, Pig or Storm, etc. Strong database skills and experience, including experience with SQL programming. Knowledge in big data technologies including cloud computing/distributed computing, data fusion, and data visualization. Experience in R programming. A background in or exposure to biomedical engineering, medical science or physiology. Good technical writing and presentation skills. Optimisation of algorithm complexity vs. accuracy vs. implementation cost. Implementing robust software for use in research programs with a minimum of review and other formal process  OK, so what next?  At ResMed, we believe in supporting, inspiring and developing our people. So we recruit the best and then give them the tools to make a real difference in the lives of our patients. We believe that fresh thinking inspires innovation – and our shared success. If this sounds like a place you would like to work and you have the drive to transform and enhance the lives of millions of patients through your contribution at work, then today is your day! Apply now!

job_description: Roles & Responsibilities If you are an engineer who's passionate about building innovative products that scale to tens of millions of pageviews a day, Indeed is looking for you. Indeed offers smart developers like you a multi-faceted development ecosystem with short release cycles. Every week sees the new release of multiple products that meet the growing needs of millions of jobseekers worldwide. As a software engineer at Indeed, you’ll be a part of a small, highly talented team of people working end-to-end on the products and services that power the world’s #1 job site. You’ll have the opportunity to impact everything from user-facing pixels on both desktop and mobile, to the backend data stores, and everything between. At Indeed, we love data. As a part of a highly data-driven organization, you won’t have to guess at the impact you’re having; you’ll leverage our large-scale data analysis infrastructure to define, measure, and test your hypotheses and deliver the best possible experience for the jobseeker. At Indeed, our primary technology stack is Java-based, but we believe strongly in using the right tool for the right job. As such, we’re rapidly adopting emerging best-of-breed technologies and incorporating them into our stack. This includes things like React/Redux, React Native, Python/Django, MongoDB, Go, and Mesos, to name a few. Additionally, sometimes the right tool for the job doesn’t exist, so we’ve created and open-sourced a number of our core systems. You can explore them on GitHub and YouTube.
job_requirements: RequirementsWe're looking for someone who  Has a passion for run-time performance  Thrives on simplifying complex information  Loves to learn and develop new skills continuously  Has a strong sense of ownership in every application they build   Requirements  BS in Computer Science or related area, or relevant work experience  3+ years experience in software development  Deep background in information retrieval (IR), knowledge representation or computational linguistics  Significant experience with large scale, high-performance systems.  Experience building solutions for high traffic web sites a plus   Indeed provides a variety of benefits that help us focus on our mission of helping people get jobs. View our bounty of perks: http://indeedhi.re/IndeedBenefits

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesEstablished in 1981, the SCHOOL OF ELECTRICAL AND ELECTRONIC ENGINEERING (EEE) http://www.eee.ntu.edu.sg is one of the founding Schools of the Nanyang Technological University. Built on a culture of excellence, the School is renowned for its high academic standards and research. With more than 150 faculty members and an enrolment of more than 4,000, of which about 1,000 are graduate students, it is one of the largest EEE schools in the world and ranks 6th in the field of Electrical & Electronic Engineering in the 2017 QS World University Rankings by Subjects. We are looking to hire a highly motivated Research Associate to work on GNSS ionospheric scintillations. The candidate must have a strong background in GNSS signal propagation and microwave/communication instruments experience with good troubleshooting skills. Good knowledge and expertise in antennas, hardware interfacing, raw data recording, data analysis, networking, electromagnetic and statistical modeling and apps programming is strongly preferred. Job Description: Responsible for research on GNSS signal propagation.  Responsible for microwave/communication instruments. job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesA.                  Areas of Responsibility – The incumbent is responsible to co-ordinate the regulatory affairs and compliance activities for all products produced throughout the world when relate to product, process and labelling. Assist and coordinate with the regulatory authorities about acceptable claims, wordings, performance data and other information requisite for marketing the products.  Participate and assist to provide material / information required by Regulatory Authority for import, reimbursement and product registration. Participate in company vigilance system including product recall activity, assisting in assessing the recall class of the recall and assuring that regulatory components of the recall are understood and complied.  Coordinate with each department and provide required documentation and gain approval for recalls / withdrawals.  Assist compliance to Equipment Qualification / Validation Program, Process and Method validation. Assist to finalize and set up the specification for approved starting raw and packaging materials, bulk solutions and finished products that meet the relevant standard and requirements. Participate and assist for establishment, verification and implementation of all company procedures to comply with cGMP and ISO requirement. Exercises responsibility for employee cGMP training such as employee orientation, Quality Awareness, and Job Training. Exercises responsibility for monitoring and control of the manufacturing process, environment and Plant hygiene including clean rooms.  Any other tasks or projects that are being assigned by the immediate supervisor, as and when required. Sustain and Active Quality Management System, such as Management Review, Internal Audit, CAPA and training. Apply appropriate auditing methodologies (sampling techniques, following audit trails, investigations, reporting etc.) Post-marketing review activities such as Customer complaints, feedback and survey. Track and analysis of quality data for non-conformance, CAPA and Change Control. Lead teams in conducting investigations related to non-conformance and /or customer complaints. Update the product technical files including risk analysis and product review. Update the relevant standard, regulatory guideline and essential requirement. Ensure documentation system comply with cGMP and ISO requirement. Author, review and/or approve documentation as required Standard Operating Procedures(SOPs), applicable deviation reports for testing, machine equipment and process related deviations etc). Co-ordinate to update Master list for all documentation. Validation plan, Calibration Program and product/ Material code. Make sure only approved supplier and approved material are used in manufacturing process. Monitor and evaluate the performance of suppliers to comply with cGMP and ISO requirement. Make sure product and material storage condition comply with the requirements of cGMP requirement and relevant standard.  Make sure production methods comply with the requirements of cGMP requirement, relevant standard and SOP. Reject, rework and dispose of Non-conforming material and product. Co-ordinate design control approvals which associated with R&D activities, new product introductions or significant product changes. Assist on the standard and regulatory correctness of labelling, including promotional material. Make sure that permanent, temporary and emergency changes to production facilities are not compromised to existing product quality and prevent new hazards and risk from being introduced into the process so that the integrity of the quality control system is maintained. B.                  Challenges of Position – The position requires the incumbent to be self-motivated to keep up with the current practices and independent decision-making. C.                  Communication Network – The incumbent must be able to communicate with his/her staffs to ensure understanding and compliance of work tasks. D.                  Measurement – The incumbent will be measured by success in achieving good QA and Regulatory affairs’ KPIs. E.                   Requirements (minimum qualification and competencies) – Diploma/Degree in Science (Biology, Chemistry, Pharmaceutical). Scientifically, materials, products and process evaluation or validation required by rules and regulations with relevant education and experience. In-depth knowledge of the cGMP, US FDA QSR and 21 CFR, EU MDD, ISO standards such as ISO 9001, ISO 13485. Demonstrated success in preparation of regulatory marketing submission to HSA, EU and other regulatory agencies. Working knowledge of data analysis techniques and product performance testing. Understanding of law, regulation and pending regulation. Understands competitive product features in comparison to products.  Provides statistical analysis for evaluation of processes.  Knowledge of basic technology employed by the business such as BFS technology, API aseptic manufacturing. Equipment and utility IQ/OQ/PQ/PV.  Identifying, writing evaluating and closing OOS’s and investigations. Leadership caliber. Gather metric information to use for continuous improvement in areas of responsibility.  Simplifying strategy into specific actions with clear accountability, making decisions with speed and accuracy based on best available information and communicating priorities clearly and concisely whilst under crisis situations to ensure compliance.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAppleCare Project Support has an immediate opening for a Project Manager with strong project-management skills. At any given time, this role may manage multiple initiatives of varying scale, complexity, and focus within the contact centre, in order to support the organisations’ overall business objectives.  The ideal candidate will have good business acumen and a strong quality ethos; be able to move smoothly between projects; communicate effectively with a variety of audiences in verbal, written, and presentation forms; gather and analyse information from a variety of disparate sources to support decisions; and will have an extensive background in Contact Centre processes and project management. Leadership Skills: Strategic thinking/analytical reasoning.  Understand how projects support business goals and ensure initiatives are aligned with business vision, strategy, and deployment within Apple. Gather, define, and document project requirements and scope; analyse impacts of various factors on scope. Use data analysis and empirical information to support conclusions and decisions. Anticipate and adjust for problems, risks, and roadblocks.   Leadership/impact and influence  Organise activities and coordinate efforts of cross-functional project teams. Lead and support teams in achieving results that are on time and consistent within the larger context of the business goal. Manage work of team members who may report through other channels. Actively resolve conflicts.   Communication/teamwork  Establish and maintain strong working relationship with peers and stakeholders, both local and globally.  Communicate concisely and clearly with internal customers, peers, business partners, and executive leadership via verbal, written, and presentation forms. Provide regular status updates to project teams, stakeholders, and management, summarising issues to key points and action required. Contribute to AppleCare Project Support team’s best-practice and represent the organisation to other internal groups and customers. Work collaboratively with project managers and business leads in other functional areas and lines of business.   Quality and results focus:  Incorporate customer satisfaction in all project activities, with the goal of improving overall experience while keeping associated costs low. Act independently, making decisions as needed in a timely manner, sometimes with incomplete information and under tight deadlines and pressure. Meet commitments and drive closure to open items. Manage and communicate changes in scope in a timely manner. Measure performance against goals, evaluate results, and hold self and others accountable.
job_requirements: Requirements 5+ years of program/project management experience ideally preferred, potentially with PMI, Six Sigma, or similar project-management certification.  Contact Centre experience a plus. Experience in managing projects of all sizes, including large, cross-functional Contact Centre or support initiatives Knowledge of and experience with project-management methodologies.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Description We are looking for a self-motivated, mature, internationally minded person with 1-3 years of consultancy or client-side experience to join our rapidly growing team in Singapore. The role is an exciting opportunity to grow within an exciting, fun and fast-moving environment in one of the most dynamic rapidly changing countries in the world. We are looking for individuals with a data and insights-focused consulting skill set, and in particular with a background in marketing, digital or social data analysis, to work on and lead a variety of engagements for MNC clients, typically in the consumer goods, hospitality, and retail industries. The successful candidate is likely to have developed a well-rounded core skill-set in their career to date, and is looking to execute data, insights and strategy engagements with large MNCs requiring in-depth and insightful analysis. This will most likely suit a proactive and self-motivated individual who enjoys client-side consulting and would relish the entrepreneurial environment of a boutique business. Key Responsibilities  Demonstrable experience in qualitative and/or quantitative research, data dash-boarding, insights-development, trend analysis, problem identification, commercial modelling, and business case development Work with clients and agency to design, gather, analyse relevant data from a variety of sources, including 1st hand market research, web analytic tools, native social media platform insights tools, media analytics, customer databases, social listening tools, search tools, research & survey tools, etc. Work with other strategists (commercial, consumer, digital and brand), creative team, production, and account services Cross resourcing with other Concise consultants on other projects as required
job_requirements: RequirementsKey Recruitment  Experience in processing and manipulating large data sets, with a key interest in data analytics Entrepreneurial, roll up the sleeves attitude Undergraduate and/or graduate degree; C. 1-3 years’ experience in a consultancy / agency / relevant client-side / relevant industry Proficiency in delivering sharp, concise work with thoughtful insights Analytical, problem-solving mentality Fluent or native English-speaker; other Asian language capability is plus

job_description: Roles & Responsibilities If you are a software engineering leader who is passionate about building innovative products that scale to ten of millions of pageview a day, Indeed is looking for you. As an engineering manager at Indeed, you will be tasked to provide hands-on leadership for a full-stack development team building and enhancing products and systems in our service-oriented, highly-scalable, multi-datacenter environment. As the organization grows, you will help to ensure we keep the talent bar high, and growing the skills and capabilities of your team. At Indeed, we love data. As a part of a highly data-driven organization, you won’t have to guess at the impact you’re having; you’ll leverage our large-scale data analysis infrastructure to define, measure, and test your hypotheses and deliver the best possible experience for the jobseeker. At Indeed, our primary technology stack is Java-based, but we believe strongly in using the right tool for the right job. As such, we’re rapidly adopting emerging best-of-breed technologies and incorporating them into our stack. This includes things like React/Redux, React Native, Python/Django, MongoDB, Go, and Mesos, to name a few. Additionally, sometimes the right tool for the job doesn’t exist, so we’ve created and open-sourced a number of our core systems. You can explore them on GitHub and YouTube.
job_requirements: Requirements Significant prior success as a Software Engineer working on challenging problems of scale  Solid knowledge of data structures and algorithms and excellent programming skills  The ability to guide a team to achieve important goals together  The desire to solve tough problems with quality software at scale  An understanding of the value derived from shipping code rapidly to production and learning/iterating on the results. Strong ability to coach developers, helping them improve their skills and grow their careers  A deep understanding of the web Strong knowledge of databases, both SQL and NoSQL  Experience with service-oriented and event-driven system architectures  Experience building high-performance distributed systems  Indeed provides a variety of benefits that help us focus on our mission of helping people get jobs. View our bounty of perks: http://indeedhi.re/IndeedBenefits

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAs a Product Manager, you will be given access to unparalleled resources within Indeed to grow and develop both personally and professionally, managing one of our core products used by millions of people every month. You will not only drive product direction by working closely with your team of developers and QA, but you will also help build the foundation of the Indeed Tokyo development center, which is a key strategic Recruit initiative to transform Recruit’s technology culture. This is a unique opportunity to work with extremely talented team members in a US-originated product development culture and environment. Responsibilities  * Understand user needs and generate new feature ideas. * Understand Indeed’s goals and strategies and work with your management to define product goals. * Flesh out ideas with wireframes, mockup designs, performance and benefit estimates and present these ideas for review. * Work with engineers to define product requirements and then lead those teams to deliver. * Collaborate with other teams, some of them remote, to deliver projects spanning multiple teams’ areas. * Build and launch new features. * Analyze lots of data, including opportunity analysis and test result analysis. * Use that data analysis to define product vision and future direction by generating new product and feature ideas that will impact the business. * Research markets and competitors.

We have deep expertise in trading, technology and operations and attribute our success to rigorous scientific research. As a technology and data-driven firm, we design and build our own cutting-edge systems, from high performance trading platforms to large scale data analysis and compute farms. job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJOB TITLE Data Steward – Front Office Data Support REPORTING TO EDM Manager ROLE Part of the small team responsible to the Director of Enterprise Data Management for managing the daily data operations KEY RESULT AREAS  Complete specialist tasks including maintaining the data in the internal data repository systems, dealing with business data queries relating to Front Office applications, etc. Data analysis and issue resolution for trade/data related queries raised by FMs, Dealers, Business Managers, etc. Ensuring that the data quality is in line with the organisation’s data management governance process Supporting the progressive transition of the organisation`s new enterprise function and capability as a BAU process throughout the various releases of the TOM Program.  KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES Eastspring Investment is establishing a new Enterprise Data Management function which puts in place a new data management capability and data governance framework to ensure the ongoing data integrity and accuracy of all Eastspring Investment data. The EDM function is being delivered progressively over the next 3 years as part of the TOM Program, a program of work which has been set up to put in place a new targeting operating model for the business. A key role in the new function is that of a small team of Data Stewards. Reporting to the Team Leader and working within a data governance framework, the Data Steward is responsible for the stewardship of the investment data that resides in Aladdin and/or the Eastspring Data Management Platform (DMP), ensuring the data is complete, consistent, fit for purpose and ready for consumption for all end users. Once this is fully established and responsibility is handed over from the Vendor (BlackRock) to the Enterprise Data Team key accountabilities of the role will include:  The daily review and validation of daily Security Master Resolution of exceptions to ensure data integrity. Set up and ongoing maintenance of new securities, portfolios, brokers and benchmarks Sourcing and Onboarding of new market data like market indexes and Aladdin unsupported data Maintaining Eastspring specific custom information such as internal ratings, customizes sectors. Continuous updates of standard operating procedures along with the new releases Provide data management input for the Change requests/new initiatives raised by various business teams Provide input to requirement documents, use cases and other papers as required. Participate in testing. Provide input to test plans and test scenarios. Test applications and processes. Ensure all new procedures are documented and agreed.  In the initial set-up of the function the Data Steward will have the following responsibility:  Creation and maintenance of new portfolios in two operating environments – current and target state systems. Monitor the data integrity in Aladdin and Legacy systems Manage and monitor data exceptions Working closely with the TOM Program Release teams to develop the appropriate data processes Undertake testing of the DMP/Aladdin during the initial releases Participate in the weekly Global data governance meetings Create Data governance policies and procedures
job_requirements: RequirementsEXPERIENCE / QUALIFICATIONS  Degree in Computing/and or Business/Finance or related disciplines An excellent understanding of a wide range of tradable instruments Strong analytical and communication skills Data management experience in large banking institution especially Investment Services sector Prior experience using investment platforms, previous experience using Blackrock is desirable Good understanding of Front Office, Trade Lifecycle and Operations processes Understanding of the data management governance frameworks Working knowledge of data vendor systems such as Bloomberg, Reuters, S&P, etc. Excellent customer focus and high level of accuracy, particularly accurate keyboard skills Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively as part of the small team.  GENERAL CANDIDATE ATTRIBUTES  A deep understanding of asset management enterprise data, its associated processes, systems, controls and deliverables. A strong ability to be hands on yet has a holistic strategic vision on data management A strong team player A performance driven individual Strong relationship management skills

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWe are a globally renown Algorithmic Trading firm, trading across a wide range of asset classes globally. We cover the global markets by leveraging and integrating technology, risk management and quantitative research. Being a proprietary trading business, we trade our own accounts and have no investors, clients or customers. We are seeking experienced individuals to join our mid- & high- frequency trading/analysis teams. Our mid- & high- frequency quantitative analysts focus on automated trading strategy development at varying time horizons. As a Quantitative Researcher / Trader you will have expertise in writing production-quality, high reliability, highly-tuned numerical code; applying tick-level data analysis and real-world trading experimentation to define strategy decision-making. You would also consider yourself proficient in trading technology but also play a pivotal role in the driving forces behind liquidity and the evolution of market microstructure. You will join a world class team in our Singapore offices and help to develop and refine such strategies applicable to the financial markets and analyze their performance. You will have displayed proven success in implementing profitable trading strategies in a team-driven environment. This role demands passion, innovation, a high attention to detail, and unwavering persistence in the pursuit of the next profit-generating idea. Individual effort is greatly appreciated, and subsequent profitability translates into generous bonuses
job_requirements: RequirementsKey skills and requirements:  Ideally a Masters or PhD in Statistics, Physics, Mathematics, Computer Sciences or similar quantitative disciplines from top schools Experience in programming using Java, C/C++, Perl, and/or Python. Exceptional quantitative as well as programming skills. Familiarity with various analytical packages (Mathematica, Matlab, Pylab, or R). Motivation and resourcefulness in quickly solving hard problems through the creative application of technology. While we analyze the data-rich domain of finance, financial experience is not an absolute requirement, though some exposure is ideal given the nature of the role Eagerness to learn new technologies.  Interested candidates can send their detailed resumes/CVs. Only shortlisted applicants will be notified for further discussions.

Our services are key to helping the local workforce in managing their careers, navigating their job search and enhancing their employability. Therefore, it is crucial that Careers Connect remains ready, relevant and responsive to the evolving labour landscape, stakeholders and most importantly - the individual's needs. You are passionate and committed to building best-in-class career services and developing people to deliver outstanding service experience - both through our online means as well as at our physical centres. You constantly look out for growth opportunities and relevant strategies to raise the bar and efficacy of our career services through performance tracking and indicators. Join a team of like-minded members who will be working closely to advance the cause.   Tasks, Duties and Responsibilities include: Employment Facilitation and Career Services  Demonstrate effective understanding of labour landscape, employment facilitation and career services delivery in Singapore Leverage Careers Connect's service data and analysis to support strategic planning and decision-making Manage in-house client management system for service reporting and stock-data analysis Conversant with workforce programmes and national schemes  Service Innovation and Development  Custodian of Careers Connects' Career Management and Counselling Programmes, Employer Engagement Programmes and other developmental projects Ideate and develop future career services, concepts and strategies to engage individuals of various levels, profiles and needs in the workforce Research to stay abreast of the latest career development and labour market trends to innovate for our services Develop and incorporate behavioural insights as part of our services to nudge individuals towards a progressive and positive mindset. Deploy design thinking sprints and/or other methods to test and prototype new service initiatives Capitalise on job and career-matching technologies to augment and raise effectiveness of services Formulate and develop service performance indicators to ascertain efficacy of programmes and services  Service Brand and Management  Spearhead efforts to showcase and proliferate the Careers Connect brand and services Develop marketing and outreach strategies to promote Careers Connect's brand and services Oversee and manage existing contents and collaterals management system across Careers Connect's channel via a content management system Partner and collaborate with stakeholders and/or vendors to curate and develop career development contents over a bi-monthly lifecycle refresh    Essential selection criteria include: Knowledge  Possess tertiary qualification Possess 3-6 years of relevant experience Product or programme marketing experiences will be an added advantage Prior experience in career development work will be an added advantage  Skills  Strong stakeholder management and coordination skills Strong project management skills Strong critical and high order thinking skills Strong system thinking skills for service and business integration Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills Strong business writing and verbal communication skills Effective business pitching, illustration and presentation skills Strong negotiation and conflict resolution skills Proficient in productivity suites such as Microsoft Office and basic content or graphic editing skills  Attributes  Affable and empathic to needs of individuals yet decisive to respond to challenges Service-oriented with focus on driving innovation Demonstrated commitment towards helping Singaporeans on their career journey and raising employability levels  Other Characteristics  Ability to converse in Mother Tongues will be an added advantage

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAs the Deputy Director of Career Services Division in Workforce Singapore Agency (WSG), you provide operational management and leadership to manage WSG’s three Careers Connect locations across Singapore. You will oversee and be responsible for operational policies and implementation of workforce programmes and career-matching initiatives, stakeholder engagement and strategies to achieve placement targets and related key performance indicators. Our career services and operations are crucial to supporting the local workforce in managing their careers through a lifetime of transitions, navigating job searches and enhancing their employability to be future-ready. You are committed to operate best-in-class career services and must be passionate about people operations to deliver an outstanding service experience to both jobseekers and employers – both online and through our physical services. You will spearhead new initiatives and projects to raise service standards, as well as the efficacy of our career-matching services and capabilities. Your team will look to you for exemplary leadership and proven experience to bring about the next chapter of growth of Careers Connect’s services to jobseekers and employers. Job Description Tasks, Duties and Responsibilities include: Employment Facilitation and Career Services  Demonstrate effective understanding of the labour landscape, facilitating employment and career services for the varied needs of individuals. Leverage Careers Connect’s data to analyse and support operations and interventions in decision-making. Oversee and advance our operational and staff capabilities for career services. Being adept and knowledgeable of recruitment trends and hiring practices in the marketplace to develop ground up initiatives. Manage in-house client management system for service reporting and stock-data analysis. Being conversant with workforce programmes and national schemes.  Service Operations and Implementation  Custodian of Careers Connect’s end-to-end, daily online and physical service operations. Manage the career services operations model, and performance score card across staff levels and teams. Refine and implement customer service operations and process improvements in consultation with HQ and Careers Connect’s Centre Management. Collaborate with HQ, Centre Management, Career Coaches and the Stakeholder Engagement Unit to implement programmes and services. Provide local audit of service operations and processes to ensure service quality and consistency. Manage service appeals and appeal channels, case escalations and other forms of Citizen-to-Government (G2C) requests. Oversee distribution and compliance of service policies across staff levels and teams. Foster a culture and attitude of service excellence and experience for staff, jobseekers and employers. Design incentive structures to recognise and reward good performance and progressive efforts. Establish business continuity and risk management for various working levels and teams across the three Careers Connect centres.  Stakeholder Engagement and Management  Direct and strategise employer engagement initiatives and efforts to pitch our Careers Connect’s clients as talents of choice to hiring employers. Pursue and intensify efforts to engage and collaborate with employers to stimulate job placements efforts and understand hiring needs. Oversee curation and advancement of career-matching systems and capabilities to raise effectiveness of job placement efforts. Direct and plan intervention support for worker displacements across industries in Singapore. Lead intra-WSG and cross-agency projects and initiatives on service and operations excellence, and employer engagement. Oversee and manage year-on-year departmental and Careers Connect’s budget and account management.  Leadership and People Management  Assemble and prepare periodic management reports and analysis to WSG Management Oversee and account for the three Careers Connects’ performance, projects and initiatives. Direct and manage multi-disciplinary teams to run and monitor day-to-day operations and services to jobseekers and employers. Render guidance and mentoring to team leads and staff on work and professional development. Supervise for optimal centre and team performance, function and load.  Essential selection criteria include:  Possess a tertiary qualification. Possess 10 – 12 years of relevant experience with at least 6 years in a managerial position with responsibility for profit and loss. Excellent system thinking ability for service and business integration. Strong business writing and business reasoning Strong verbal communication and critical thinking skills.
